examples: I accidentally hit the wrong key.
I accidentally burned my hand on the hot stove.
He accidentally put his underwear on inside out.
He accidentally dropped a heavy book on his friend's foot, narrowly missing the toes.
I accidentally buttered both sides of the bread when making a sandwich.
words.defineEn: happening by chance and without planning in advance
words.defineVi: xảy ra một cách tình cờ và không có kế hoạch trước

examples: As a project manager, I try to be realistic about timelines and resources.
When it comes to taking on responsibilities or projects, it's important to be realistic about what you can handle.
Setting realistic and achievable targets is important for maintaining motivation.
Is it realistic?
Is it realistic?
words.defineEn: concerned with or based on something that is real or practical
words.defineVi: liên quan đến hoặc dựa trên một cái gì đó là có thật hoặc thực tế

examples: But nowadays, researchers think that a perfect storm of environmental factors is causing this everlasting light show.
I would call it everlasting.
(may Jesus Christ lead you into everlasting life.)
Recent research has suggested some plastics aren't as everlasting as we thought.
Secondly, the structures that drive hair growth are called hair follicles, a network of complex organs that forms before we're born, and grows hair in an everlasting cycle.
words.defineEn: enduring indefinitely, without end or limit
words.defineVi: kéo dài vô tận, không có kết thúc hoặc giới hạn

examples: The superintendent believed Lancaster's story.
The tabloid press ran the story.
The story ran on page 4 of the print edition of the newspaper.
The true story inspired many people around the world.
The figures tell a different story.
words.defineEn: a description of events and people either real or imaginary
words.defineVi: một mô tả về các sự kiện và con người có thật hoặc tưởng tượng

examples: They exchanged views on every subject under the sun.
Our policy only allows for exchanges.
The couple knelt before the altar to exchange their vows.
The thug threw dust in her eyes and exchanged her real diamonds with fake stones.
The conference is a good place to share information and exchange ideas.
words.defineEn: to give something to someone and receive something else from them
words.defineVi: để cung cấp cho một cái gì đó cho một ai đó và nhận được một cái gì đó khác từ họ

examples: When Sarah's friends teased her about her unusual tastes in music and art, she reminded them that every Jack has his Jill, and she would eventually find someone who appreciated her interests.
The person may have unusual mannerisms.
Lamborghini situation is not unusual.
Kathy's situation is not unusual.
Was that unusual?
words.defineEn: not commonly happening or done
words.defineVi: không thường xảy ra hoặc thực hiện

examples: Liza mended her fences by making amends with his family.
The two neighbors mend fences by discussing their concerns and finding common ground.
With the help of a therapist, the couple is on the mend and is working through the challenges in their relationship.
After a few days of rest and medication, Emily is on the mend and expects to be back to work soon.
After a series of setbacks and missteps, the team regrouped and found themselves on the mend, with a renewed sense of purpose and a clear plan for moving forward.
words.defineEn: to fix something that is damaged or broken so it can work or be used again
words.defineVi: để sửa chữa một cái gì đó bị hư hỏng hoặc bị hỏng để nó có thể hoạt động hoặc được sử dụng lại

examples: The secrecy and danger of their forbidden romance only added to their passion, as they both believed that stolen kisses are the sweetest.
A forbidden transition is one that's just very unlikely to happen.
Calling you late at night, contacting family members, or threatening you with arrest are all strictly forbidden.
And, they’ll be on the lookout for other forbidden planets.
Some Americans cannot help but flash a broad grin or utter a forbidden snicker.
words.defineEn: not allowed or permitted to be done
words.defineVi: không được phép hoặc được phép thực hiện

examples: The farmer witnessed the birth of a baby calf in the barn.
He was blind from birth.
Last year, Monica had bun in the oven and gave birth to a beautiful baby girl.
As the son of a wealthy family, he had many advantages at birth, but he knew that birth is much but breeding more, and worked hard to receive a good education and upbringing.
As the son of a wealthy family, he had many advantages at birth, but he knew that birth is much but breeding more, and worked hard to receive a good education and upbringing.
words.defineEn: the event or process of a baby being born
words.defineVi: sự kiện hoặc quá trình của một em bé được sinh ra

examples: Now, this can't go beyond these four walls, but Janet told me that she's pregnant!
Now, I don't want anyone to know that I'm pregnant yet, so mum's the word.
Shirley was four months pregnant and just starting to show.
There are designated seats for elderly and pregnant passengers on the subway.
Someone who is pregnant can pass a disease onto their child.
words.defineEn: describing a woman or a female animal that carries a baby inside her or its body
words.defineVi: mô tả một người phụ nữ hoặc một con vật cái mang một em bé bên trong cơ thể của mình hoặc của nó

examples: Expecting eight guests all told.
Expect these changes to happen soon.
The company's new product launch is expected to do well in the market.
The novel was expected to sell between 1 000 and 1 500 copies.
Thousands of firms are expected to go to the wall this year.
words.defineEn: to be pregnant and awaiting the birth of a child
words.defineVi: mang thai và chờ đợi sự ra đời của một đứa trẻ

examples: The baby had chubby cheeks and a cute face.
The baby cried its head off.
The baby has brought them great joy.
The mother gently cradled her newborn baby in her arms.
The lioness carefully groomed her newborn baby.
words.defineEn: a child who is very young, usually too young to walk or speak
words.defineVi: một đứa trẻ còn rất nhỏ, thường còn quá nhỏ để đi hoặc nói

examples: The brain weighs about three pounds.
Congress weighed the pros and cons of the new tax plan.
He spoke very slowly, weighing his words.
He gave evidence to the court, weighing each word as he spoke.
I've been weighing his words all day, trying to figure out what he meant.
words.defineEn: to discover how heavy someone or something is
words.defineVi: để khám phá xem ai đó hoặc cái gì đó nặng như thế nào

examples: So, this is the Born This Way Multi-Use Sculpting Concealer.
Just Born was actually looking for jelly bean technology.
Just Born decided to ramp up production of these gooey treats.
Peeps make up 70% of Just Born's annual revenue.
We visited Just Born's Pennsylvania factory to see how these iconic treats come to life.
words.defineEn: brought to this world through birth
words.defineVi: mang đến thế giới này thông qua sinh

examples: The rent is coming due next week.
Although I'm not showing yet, my baby is due in the spring.
We have a science project due next week at school.
With all due respect, Sir, I cannot agree with your last statement.
The team's success was due in part to their understanding that a bird never flew on one wing, and that each member's contributions were necessary for achieving their goals.
words.defineEn: scheduled or appointed to happen at a certain time
words.defineVi: dự kiến hoặc bổ nhiệm để xảy ra tại một thời điểm nhất định

examples: Their marriage is on shaky ground.
The couple's marriage turned into a cat-and-dog life.
That marriage won't last.
Marriage has been on the cards from day one.
Their marriage began to fall to pieces after only a few months.
words.defineEn: the formal and legal relationship between two people who are married
words.defineVi: mối quan hệ chính thức và hợp pháp giữa hai người đã kết hôn

examples: I was recently divorced and feeling at a very low ebb.
I had just gotten divorced and it was what you do when you get divorced.
Or maybe it's a marriage and you get divorced.
Katie lives above the pub run by her divorced dad.
But thirties to fifties: lawyers, you want lawyer friends cause you're gonna, you're gonna get divorced.
words.defineEn: no longer married to someone because the marriage has been legally ended
words.defineVi: không còn kết hôn với ai đó vì cuộc hôn nhân đã kết thúc hợp pháp

examples: He's very engaged in environmental issues and volunteers for a local conservation group.
He always sits in the front row during class to stay focused and engaged.
And she became more and more engaged.
and she’s an engaged teacher.
He's always interested in a lot of different things, but those things which he's really interested in, politics and family and faith and sports, he gets deeply engaged.
words.defineEn: having formally agreed to marry someone
words.defineVi: đã chính thức đồng ý kết hôn với ai đó

examples: My parents are married and have been together for a long time.
They have built a life together as a married couple, sharing responsibilities and dreams.
I can't believe John is in bed with his married coworker!
After years of dating, they finally decided to tie the knot and start their journey as a married couple.
Like most married couples we've had our ups and downs, but life's like that.
words.defineEn: having a wife or husband
words.defineVi: có vợ hoặc chồng

words.defineEn: referring to an individual whose spouse has died and who has not remarried
words.defineVi: đề cập đến một cá nhân có người phối ngẫu đã chết và người đã không tái hôn

examples: I was enjoying every single cut of marinated chicken, beef, and pork.
The ticket for the bus is valid for a single journey.
My siblings and I share a single bedroom in our house.
Some of the people don't deserve a single red cent.
Not a single jot or tittle goes past the eye of the boss without her noticing.
words.defineEn: not in a relationship or marriage
words.defineVi: không phải trong một mối quan hệ hoặc hôn nhân

examples: She felt her mother's death very deeply.
Her death should serve as a warning to other young people.
He met his death in 1946.
Today's lecture bored me to death.
Some of my patients are actually staring death in the face.
words.defineEn: the end of life; the act of dying
words.defineVi: cuối đời; hành động chết

examples: The old customs are dying.
All men must die.
The flowers died during a dry spell.
My father died suddenly at the age of 48.
The die is cast.
words.defineEn: to no longer be alive
words.defineVi: không còn sống

examples: The old captain was dead as a dodo.
The owners were dead as mutton.
This fish is as dead as a herring.
Dead men can't talk.
But this bird was as dead as a dodo.
words.defineEn: not alive anymore
words.defineVi: không còn sống nữa

examples: He never missed a televised basketball or football game.
I missed the part where that's my problem.
but we missed them.
She received a missed call from an unknown phone number.
You've missed your mark three times in a row.
words.defineEn: to feel sad because we no longer can see someone or do something
words.defineVi: cảm thấy buồn vì chúng ta không còn có thể nhìn thấy ai đó hoặc làm điều gì đó

examples: Look alive!
Surprisingly, the quiet neighborhood came alive with vibrant festivities during the annual festival.
Everyone would've ate him alive if he went for it and failed.
Look alive boys we got a lot to do.
Let us know you're alive
words.defineEn: not dead; living
words.defineVi: không chết; cuộc sống

words.defineEn: without any deliberate intent or planning
words.defineVi: mà không có bất kỳ ý định cố ý hoặc kế hoạch

examples: Others favor a less lifelike approach.
and it sounded really lifelike.
Harry is a humanoid robot with lifelike skin.
His work was unlike the Fauves, aspiring to more lifelike coloration and representation.
Several of Hanson's robots are incredibly lifelike.
words.defineEn: having the appearance or qualities that closely resemble or imitate real life
words.defineVi: có ngoại hình hoặc phẩm chất gần giống hoặc bắt chước ngoài đời thực

words.defineEn: continuing or going on without ever coming to an end, without cessation, or without conclusion
words.defineVi: tiếp tục hoặc tiếp tục mà không bao giờ kết thúc, không có điểm dừng hoặc không có kết luận

examples: We swapped states.
So the alveoli and capillaries basically just swap one gas for another.
So we swap the numerator and the denominator.
I just swapped the sides.
She's swapping.
words.defineEn: to give something to a person and in return receive something else
words.defineVi: để cung cấp cho một cái gì đó cho một người và đổi lại nhận được một cái gì đó khác

examples: These books belong in the library's rare collection.
John collects rare stamps from around the world.
That comedian was really in rare form last night.
They're raring to go!
As he hiked through the wilderness, he stumbled upon a rare cycad species.
words.defineEn: extremely uncommon and happening or done infrequently
words.defineVi: cực kỳ không phổ biến và xảy ra hoặc thực hiện không thường xuyên

examples: Can you tell this copy from the original?
The gardens have recently been restored to their original glory.
I'm really surprised that the sequel even holds a candle to the original.
The scientist had to eat crow and revise their theory after new evidence contradicted their original findings.
We bit off more than we could chew in our original reform proposals.
words.defineEn: existing at the start of a specific period or process
words.defineVi: tồn tại khi bắt đầu một giai đoạn hoặc quá trình cụ thể

examples: The repair is a cinch.
The relationship between the two friends had deteriorated beyond repair.
The landlord finally made some repairs in the apartment, but it was only after several complaints and threats of legal action, and a forced kindness deserves no thanks.
He's still on the hook for the cost of the repairs.
Repairing or regrowing damaged brain cells is the end of the rainbow for neuroscience research.
words.defineEn: to restore something to a good condition; to fix something that is damaged, broken, or not working properly
words.defineVi: để khôi phục một cái gì đó về tình trạng tốt; để sửa chữa một cái gì đó bị hư hỏng, bị hỏng, hoặc không hoạt động bình thường

examples: A ramp allows easy access for wheelchairs.
The judge allowed my claim.
Our policy only allows for exchanges.
I allow myself a treat now and then.
The prisoners are allowed out of their cells for two hours a day.
words.defineEn: to let someone or something do a particular thing
words.defineVi: để cho ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó làm một điều cụ thể

examples: The crowd wished them well as they left for their honeymoon.
Well the honeymoon ended.
I said, "The honeymoon stage?"
What's after the honeymoon stage?
It was like the honeymoon phase, right?
words.defineEn: a holiday taken by newlyweds
words.defineVi: một kỳ nghỉ được thực hiện bởi các cặp vợ chồng mới cưới

words.defineEn: to legally become someone's wife or husband
words.defineVi: để hợp pháp trở thành vợ hoặc chồng của một ai đó

examples: Can you split up the check?
Her parents essentially split up as soon as she was born.
Wilcox splits up the meat based on type.
Or however phone numbers are split up in your area.
For one thing, the scientists didn’t split up the prisoners randomly and put half in pink rooms and the other half in, say, white rooms.
words.defineEn: to end a romantic relationship or marriage
words.defineVi: để kết thúc một mối quan hệ lãng mạn hoặc hôn nhân

examples: If Ann remarried the estate would pass to her new husband.
He had remarried, had a new daughter.
At one point they even divorced, then remarried a year later.
The two would remarry the following year, but their relationship was extremely volatile for its duration.
Constance remarried late in life and loved nothing more, until her passing at age 97, than to be surrounded by her new extended family.
words.defineEn: to marry again after the death of a previous spouse or after a divorce
words.defineVi: kết hôn lần nữa sau cái chết của người phối ngẫu trước hoặc sau khi ly hôn

examples: They celebrated their anniversary with a romantic seafood dinner at a waterfront restaurant
My grandparents celebrated their sixtieth wedding anniversary.
They celebrated their anniversary at a fancy restaurant overlooking the city.
She planned a romantic candlelit meal for their anniversary.
Finally the couple may be celebrating a birthday, a wedding anniversary or some other red-letter day.
words.defineEn: the date on which a special event happened in a previous year
words.defineVi: ngày mà một sự kiện đặc biệt đã xảy ra trong một năm trước

examples: That hot guy had a good head on his shoulders.
The hotel had expensive rates during the holiday season.
The group has a new CD in the pipeline.
The police had the situation well in hand.
The theatre company has several new productions in the pipeline for next season.
words.defineEn: to be pregnant or give birth to a baby
words.defineVi: mang thai hoặc sinh em bé

examples: You can afford a dollar for a good cause.
He could no longer afford to run a car.
I couldn't afford to waste petrol chasing rainbows as far as Leeds and back.
They can't afford to buy school books.
We can't afford to strain at gnats and swallow camels.
words.defineEn: to be able to pay the cost of something
words.defineVi: để có thể trả chi phí của một cái gì đó

examples: Her behavior toward her colleagues was unprofessional.
She left him for a colleague.
John introduced his wife to his colleagues at the company dinner party.
The experienced lawyer is streets ahead of her young colleagues, with a deep understanding of the law and years of courtroom experience.
The two colleagues worked together closely and, over time, developed a strong rapport.
words.defineEn: someone with whom one works
words.defineVi: một người mà một người làm việc

examples: Poor Jane really sobbed her heart out during the funeral service.
Poor Jane really fell apart at the seams during the funeral service.
I didn't think she'd want to go back to work so soon after her mother's funeral, but she just took it in stride.
When attending a funeral, it's the done thing to dress in black or other somber colors.
"The good die young," said the pastor sadly at Robert's funeral, for even at the age of 80, his kindness, faith and generosity made his passing feel far too soon.
words.defineEn: a religious ceremony in which people bury or cremate a dead person
words.defineVi: một nghi lễ tôn giáo trong đó mọi người chôn cất hoặc hỏa táng một người chết
